key_differences: Gemini leans to neutral IC, Perplexity leans credit put spread

weaknesses: Suggested spreads require wide margin but also advises wait

major_disagreements.judge_resolution: Irrelevant because both recommend: DO NOT ENTER TODAY

disagreement_resolution.resolution_approach: Consensus aligned on NO TRADE so directional/strategy debate postponed

final_verdict.confidence_reasoning: Two independent models plus market data confirm high binary risk and low edge

if_no_trade.primary_reason: Extreme binary Fed risk + low implied volatility
contributing_factors: Premiums do not compensate gap risk
if_no_trade.what_would_change_this: Fed outcome priced in + IV crush + NIFTY remains 25750-25950
if_no_trade.wait_until: Tomorrow morning after Fed reaction stabilises

dissenting_opinion.counter_argument: Low IV and stable range could reward a small credit spread
dissenting_opinion.why_overruled: Event risk outweighs reward — both models warned to wait

pre_trade_checklist: [ ] Wait until post-Fed announcement and first 30–60 min price discovery
[ ] Ensure VIX does NOT spike above 13
[ ] Spot should be stabilising in 25750-25950 range
post_trade_checklist: [ ] Re-assess payoff zones based on new OI
[ ] Consider fresh entry tomorrow if range re-establishes

best_case.scenario: Fed dovish → volatility crush → great premium entries tomorrow

expected_case.scenario: Sharp move → both proposed spreads become unsafe

worst_case.scenario: Enter now → gap move wipes defined risk spread

judge_notes.key_insight: Low VIX + Fed event = asymmetric risk:reward against entering today
judge_notes.what_to_watch: IV spike or collapse after Fed — gives clarity for tomorrow
judge_notes.lessons_for_future: Even when setup favours premium selling, macro binary risk overrides signal quality

final_one_liner: NO TRADE — Fed risk + low volatility means the edge is negative; reassess tomorrow.
